de.tshw.worktracker.dao

Class DataAccessObject<T extends Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tshw.worktracker.dao.DataAccessObject<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Entity to be managed by this DAO, needs to inherit from Entity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProjectDAO, WorkLogEntryDAO

    public abstract class DataAccessObject<T extends Entity>
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple abstraction for a data access object.

    Inherit from this class to create a straight-forwards DAO to handle basic read and write database operations for your entities.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataAccessObject(DatabaseProvider dbProvider)
      Create an instance of this DAO.

      • DataAccessObject

        public DataAccessObject(DatabaseProvider dbProvider)
        Create an instance of this DAO.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getDbProvider

        protected DatabaseProvider getDbProvider()
        Retrieve the database provider.

        Usually used as getDbProvider().getDatabaseConnection(); right before a database statement is issued.

        Returns:
        The provider that arranges the database connection

      • cacheEntity

        protected void cacheEntity(long id,
                           T object)
        Store an entity in the object cache.

        Note: The class mostly deals with caching itself.

        Parameters:
        id - Cache entry key, usually the entity's ID
        object - The actual object to be cached

      • getCachedEntity

        protected T getCachedEntity(long id)
        Retrieve an entity from the object cache.

        Note: The class mostly deals with caching itself.

        Parameters:
        id - Cache entry key, usually the entity's ID
        Returns:
        The cached entity or null, if it isn't cached
        See Also:
        isEntityCached(long)

      • isEntityCached

        protected boolean isEntityCached(long id)
        Check if an entity is already cached.

        Note: The class mostly deals with caching itself.

        Parameters:
        id - Cache entry key, usually the entity's ID
        Returns:
        true, if the entity is in the cache; false otherwise

      • getAll

        public java.util.List<T> getAll()
        Retrieve all entities of this DAO's type from the database.
        Returns:
        List of all entities in the database, sorted by the default sorting defined in getDefaultOrderBy()

      • findById

        public T findById(long id)
        Retrieve a single entity of this DAO's type from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the entity to retrieve
        Returns:
        Found entity or null if it wasn't found

      • save

        public void save(T entity)
        Save an entity to the database.

        You can call this with a new or an already known entity. If it isn't in the database yet, it will be inserted and an ID will be assigned to it. Otherwise the existing entry will be updated.

        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to store in the database

      • delete

        public void delete(T entity)
        Deletes a known entity from the database.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to delete

      • getEntityFromResultSet

        protected T getEntityFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet result)
        Converts a single database query result into the actual entity object.

        Also takes care of internal caching to prevent the creation of multiple objects for the same entity.

        Parameters:
        result - Query result, iterated to the row to be extracted
        Returns:
        Fully populated entity object

      • getIdColumnName

        protected java.lang.String getIdColumnName()
        Get the ID database column for this entity.

        Overwrite this method only if you really need to change the name of the ID column.

        Returns:
        Name of the database field for this entity's ID

      • getSelectByIdStatement

        protected java.lang.String getSelectByIdStatement()
        Get the SQL statement to retrieve a single entity via its ID.

        This statement contains a single placeholder for the entity's ID.

        Returns:
        SQL statement

      • getSelectAllStatement

        protected java.lang.String getSelectAllStatement()
        Get the SQL statement to retrieve all entities of this DAO's type.

        This statement contains no placeholders at all.

        Returns:
        SQL statement

      • getInsertStatement

        protected java.lang.String getInsertStatement()
        Get the SQL statement to insert a new entity into the database.

        This statement contains n placeholders, one for each field of the entity. The order follows the one introduced in getFieldList().

        Returns:
        SQL statement

      • getUpdateStatement

        protected java.lang.String getUpdateStatement()
        Get the SQL statement to update an existing entity in the database.

        This statement contains n+1 placeholders, where 1..n are for the entity's fields. The order follows the one introduced in getFieldList(). The n+1th parameter is for the entity's ID.

        Returns:
        SQL statement

      • getDeleteStatement

        protected java.lang.String getDeleteStatement()
        Get the SQL statement to delete an existing entity from the database.

        This statement contains a single placeholder for the entity's ID.

        Returns:
        SQL statement

      • getTableName

        protected java.lang.String getTableName()
        Get the name of the database table to be used for this DAO's entity.

        Only overwrite this method, if you don't want the name to be the same as the entity's.

        Returns:
        Name of the database table

      • getEntityName

        protected abstract java.lang.String getEntityName()
        Get the name of the managed entity. This is used to determine the database table name and for error handling purposes.

        If you need to change the name of the database table name, overwrite getTableName().

        Returns:
        Name of the entity handled by this DAO

      • getFieldList

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getFieldList()
        Get the list of database fields that are used for this entity.

        The order is order of these fields is important and you will need it for the implementation of setInsertUpdateParameters(java.sql.PreparedStatement, T).

        Returns:
        List of database fields for this entity

      • getDefaultOrderBy

        protected abstract java.lang.String getDefaultOrderBy()
        Get the default sorting order statement.

        This will be used by some of the standard SQL statements.

        Returns:
        Default SQL order by clause

      • mapFieldsToEntity

        protected abstract T mapFieldsToEntity(java.sql.ResultSet result)
        This method is called when a database query result needs to be converted into an actual entity object.

        The ResultSet has already been iterated to the correct row. Retrieve all of your fields from the result and place the values inside your newly created entity object.

        Note: You don't have to set the ID yourself, the DAO will take care of it.

        Parameters:
        result - Database query result, iterated to the right row
        Returns:
        Fully populated entity object

      • setInsertUpdateParameters

        protected abstract void setInsertUpdateParameters(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
                                                  T entity)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called when the DAO is executing an insert or update statement to poopulate the field values.

        Retrieve all values from your entity and assign them to the statement's parameters in the same order as you returned the field values in getFieldList().

        The parameters are counted from 1..n, where n is the total number of fields.

        Parameters:
        statement - SQL stamement to be populated with parameter values
        entity - Entity to take the parameter values from
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when accessing a parameter that doesn't exist

      • ensureForeignKeyConsistency

        protected void ensureForeignKeyConsistency(T entity)
        Handle relationships to other entities.

        If your entity has relationships with other entities, use this method to make sure they are stored to the database before a foreign key constraint can fail.

        You might have to adjust your constructor to make sure you have access to a DAO for the related Entity.

        Parameters:
        entity - Entity that is about to be stored to the database
